file_content.text: You'll be briefed further aboard your ship. I've done all I can.
...the Emperor and his proxies have made their intent clear. Their fleets are entering the Core systems. They have broken the Treaty of Coruscant.
Along the Mid Rim, they herd our people into makeshift prisons out of fear of rebellion. Unspeakable crimes have been committed.
Survivors in the Mid Rim report the near-wholesale slaughter of colonies. Surrender isn't enough--they only want death.
Their captives--our surrendered colonies--are going silent.
Let there be no mistake: we are at war.
Display off.
Tell me, Cipher--what's your assessment of your mission at Isen Four?
We identified Hunter's role in a clandestine operation, even if its purpose isn't yet clear. We also captured evidence.
Mixed success.
Yes. That evidence--the device used to sabotage the colony.
The mission was a failure. The target escaped, and I couldn't prevent the massacre.
I didn't catch Hunter.
But you found the device used in Colony Control, and that's what we needed.
I should have been with the fleet. You're wasting my time on trivia.
You made me miss the war.
Trivia like the device used to sabotage the colony?
Fixer Twelve recognized the override technology from Operation Starbender, eight years ago. That mission was also an anomaly.
How are the new Watchers working out?
Their brains are faster than mine, sir, and they don't need as much sleep. This generation seems promising.
It's been a while since we spoke in person, sir.
Hello, Keeper.
I doubt they have your looks or charm. It's good to see you.
[Flirt] You look wonderful.
And you, Cipher Nine.
When's the last time you were off duty?
You look tired.
Forty-six hours, nineteen minutes. The department's been busy.
Tell her about Starbender.
Tell him about Starbender.
What were you saying about the sabotage device?
Get back to the subject.
Keeper?
Starbender was a disaster, or it should've been. A pirate fleet was about to destroy an Imperial base... when the pirates' flagship exploded.
It was sabotaged by unknown persons. We were saved using the same technology that destroyed Isen Four.
Realizing that, I reviewed other "lucky incidents"--Operations Morning Crest and Vanity--looking for other occurrences of this technology.
That's when you found the recording?
Yes. Caught by accident four years ago, simultaneous with Morning Crest.
...reporting. I am inside the SIS.
Maintain cover for six months, then proceed. Guard your thoughts when near the Jedi.
Understood.
These people have been intervening in our affairs. I assume you recognize the voice.
I recognize the servant, but not the master.
Hunter has a superior.
Yes. Go on.
You're talking about old operations, strange technology... how does it all connect?
I don't understand.
Hunter's massacre was enabled by a mystery technology we've seen before--but never traced.
Not every anomaly has an easy answer. You're afraid of your own shadows.
You're both overreacting.
Intelligence leaks. Rogue agents. Colony massacres. These are shadows to you?
Please continue.
At the Minister's suggestion, the Watchers and I began searching the unsolved case files for patterns of outside intervention.
We've found sixty-two relevant incidents so far. The oldest go back centuries--before the Empire revealed itself to the galaxy. But nine are from the past five years.
Whom do you deem responsible?
In my analysis... an organization with espionage training and extensive resources, unaffiliated with the Republic or the Empire. Motivations unknown.
You must have some guess where they come from, what they're after.
Any theories?
We are working on it. The pieces just aren't there.
You're proposing some kind of secret society. No one goes hidden that long.
You know this sounds crazy.
I'd like to agree. But nothing else fits.
Hunter tried to use me, and then he tried to kill me. I want to return the favor.
They've made an enemy of me.
With the Republic at our doorstep, now is not the time to be chasing conspiracies and ghosts. But we have little choice.
Someone is manipulating this war. Someone who destroyed the Shadow Arsenal and Isen Four. Who gave the SIS your keyword.
I need you to find these invisible agents before they do something catastrophic.
I'll expose these people, and I'll learn the truth.
Understood, sir.
You need me on the front lines. The Republic military and the SIS won't wait.
What about the Republic?
You won't be ignoring wartime duties. You'll be dividing your time.
One way or another, this is my last mission from you.
After this... we're finished.
Perhaps. Do the job first.
We've identified thirteen possible leads on the enemy, all offworld. We'll narrow those down by the time you reach your ship.
Good. Get an hour's rest, then return to work.
And you... Darth Jadus wants to see you before you leave the planet. I'll send him our findings here.
I have a conference with Darth Baras and the Minister of War. I'll keep this operation secret as long as I can... but our foes will find out. Be wary.
The Watchers will send mission data to your ship. Best of luck.
Kaliyo Djannis? I'll be interviewing you now.
Last girl who tried broke her jaw. Don't be like her.
Vector Hyllus? Come with me for debriefing.
We'll sing you our journey's song, but we'll need the main hall for the acoustics....
Raina Temple? Your debriefing.
My first. I'm a little nervous.
Doctor Lokin? You'll have to come with me.
I haven't had a proper debriefing in ages. Do you still use the N-wave scanners...?
Sir. Someone will be with you shortly.
It isn't my office anymore, but Keeper is occupied and I thought we should talk. It's been a long time, agent.
I haven't seen you since Eradication Day. Keeper said you were promoted to Minister of Intelligence.
I wasn't expecting you, sir.
Yes. My wife says the position suits me.
I don't remember that from when you ran the place.
Who's the droid?
I'm not your agent anymore. I am the Hand of Jadus, and my life belongs to him.
I serve a Sith Lord now.
Of course. Your loyalty is commendable.
The new Minister of Intelligence. You signed off on my brainwashing.
You have a lot to answer for.
Remote?
Scan complete. No listening devices found.
It'll broadcast white noise for ten minutes. Complete privacy, even from your master.
Broadcast mode. White noise, ten minutes, then leave.
Yes, I did approve your programming. I also know you stole our files, and I know you freed yourself.
We may as well be honest. I know about the stolen files. I know you discovered your brainwashing and freed yourself. And yes, I was responsible.
I represent the Empire and our lord of the Dark Council. Yet you moved against me.
You defied Jadus.
I gave my life to the Empire. Is this how you reward loyalty?
How could you do it?
Tell me why.
You must have had reasons.
Did you know that Ardun Kothe was controlling me? I was his puppet!
I suffered because of you!
That was unfortunate, and unplanned.
Darth Jadus made no friends when he rose to power. But the other Sith had to act quietly. They wanted insurance against you.
If I hadn't approved your programming, they'd have found another way, and I'd be dead. I don't plan to tell anyone you're free.
It was your duty to inform us--not to collaborate with traitors.
Jadus and I should've known.
I gambled, and you came out intact. Maybe that isn't enough--but there's something else you should consider.
The Sith wanted you under control. You survived Darth Jadus; how long before you defied another on the Dark Council?
The programming was a safeguard, and if I hadn't approved it, you'd be dead. I don't plan to tell anyone you're free.
Don't blame the Sith. This was your choice, your project. And I wasn't the first victim.
That doesn't make it right.
I blame no one. But you're the least of the sins I've committed, and there's something you should consider.
The Republic had the keyword. Where did they get it?
How did the SIS know about it?
That's an excellent question.
You took away my life. Maybe I should take away yours.
I should make you pay.
I'm sure you're capable of it. But before you shoot me, consider this:
Go ahead. You'll have nine minutes to escape Dromund Kaas.
But, should you decide not to sabotage your career, I suggest you put aside your outrage and consider this:
The SIS should never have possessed Imperial brainwashing codes; Ardun Kothe's shuttle was found abandoned in space without any data on your "Shadow Arsenal"....
...and according to our records, there's no evidence of an agent "Hunter" ever existing.
He doesn't want us finding any evidence--of himself or the operation.
He's covering his tracks.
Agreed. Given what we know, I find that disturbing.
You're avoiding the subject. You're scared.
Don't get off-topic.
I'm showing you the truth.
What are you saying?
Why would I make any of that up? Why would my team support me?
You think I'm lying?
I don't doubt your story.
Someone--your Hunter or his employer--is manipulating this war for his own ends. Someone with access to both Republic and Imperial resources.
This someone gave Ardun Kothe your keyword. We need to find out who and why.
Last time I saw Hunter was on Quesh, but he's long gone by now.
Let's go after Hunter.
What sort of person could pull those strings? Imperial Intelligence and SIS, not to mention Jedi and Sith....
Who could manipulate everyone?
Let's not elaborate on theories until we have facts.
You sound like a lunatic. There's no secret power responsible for this.
That's paranoia.
No one thought there was a secret power behind the Eagle's terrorists, either.
Fortunately, the trail is still warm. Yesterday, a man fitting Hunter's description boarded a shuttle to the Isen Four asteroid colony.
Nine hours ago, we received this message:
Imperial Fleet Command--this is Representative Omana Tragg of the Isen Four mining colony. We have been monitoring your victories in this sector.
While we continue to accept refugee transports, our defense systems are minimal, and our population is ninety percent civilian. We cannot afford a confrontation.
Under Republic law, I am authorized to discuss terms of surrender. All weapons powering down.
Our forces will arrive there tomorrow. We don't know if the colony's surrender is related to Hunter's arrival, but I want you after him.
If Hunter is still at the colony, I'll find him.
I'll head there immediately.
Very well. We'll speak again soon.
What would he need at a Republic mining colony?
Why would he go to Isen Four?
The Watchers are collating data on the facility and known occupants. Hopefully, they'll find out.
If not, it's up to you.
You can find as many distractions as you like. I'm not going to forget what you did.
I'm not finished with you!
No. But you need my help to find our enemies. When you're done, if you still want revenge... I'll be here.
Then we'll finish this another time.
Fair enough.
I became the Hand of Jadus to effect change, Minister. Now it seems nothing will.
This whole Empire is corrupt.
It's not revenge I'm after. But my service to the Empire has limits.
I can't do this job forever.
There's going to be a reckoning between us, Minister. And all the maneuvering in the world won't save you.
You're going to regret this.
For now, though... I have a rogue SIS agent to catch.
What is your purpose here?
